byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

abstract: Lufthansa, parent company of Germanwings, offers families of those who died in March crash in French mountains $28,000 each; offer, the first for emotional damages in case, is dismissed out of hand by lawyers for relatives.
lead_paragraph: Lufthansa proposed on Tuesday to pay $28,000 each in emotional damages to the German victims’ families, an amount dismissed as inadequate by lawyers for the families.

headline.main: Lufthansa Offers Compensation to Families of Germanwings Crash Victims
headline.print_headline: Lufthansa Offers to Pay Damages Over Crash

snippet: Lufthansa proposed on Tuesday to pay $28,000 each in emotional damages to the German victims’ families, an amount dismissed as inadequate by lawyers for the families.
